title: Ticket #992: problems with GSI in 7.4.0
description: it seems the server does not trust a client when the client is using a proxy. it seems to work correctly when the client has a cert/key combo.
remarks:
2009-Nov-20 15:05:31 by zmiller:
i started up a personal condor with GSI authentication enabled and was able to authenticate using a proxy. so things aren't completely broken. now i need to understand what is different between my setup and fermi's, and also what changed between condor 7.2.4 (globus 4.2.0) and condor 7.4.0 (globus 4.2.1) that could cause this.

2009-Nov-20 16:10:08 by zmiller:
new information: condor GSI authentication works fine if you are using a "legacy" proxy. these are created by default with older versions grid-proxy-init (e.g. 0.9), and by using the "-old" flag to newer versions of grid-proxy-init (e.g. 0.18). the proxy that fermilab is using is type "Proxy draft (pre-RFC) compliant impersonation proxy" which does indeed not work when using GSI authentication in 7.4.0.

i offered them the workaround of using "-old" while i investigate the problem further.

2009-Nov-25 11:02:14 by danb:
voms-proxy-init produces a legacy proxy by default, which probably explains why Igor's GSI-authenticated glidein test did not catch this.

2009-Nov-25 15:21:52 by danb:
The problem appears to be caused by [15796] #786 (Remove VOMS static initializer).

2009-Nov-25 16:05:25 by zmiller:
setting USE_VOMS_ATTRIBUTES = FALSE in the condor_config works around the problem and GSI authentication works using any style of proxy (legacy, pre-RFC, RFC). i've given this same advice to fermi as a temporary workaround while we fix the problem.

2009-Dec-03 08:55:47 by zmiller:
fermi is content to wait until 7.4.1 to get the fix to this problem.
